cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest tonight, then turning north and north-northeast on Friday toward the southwest Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron, Louisiana (just southwest of Lake Charles)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning (also under Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch east of the mouth of the Pearl River to Bay St. Louis, MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from High Island, TX to Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Warning from High Island, TX to Ocean Springs, MS including Calcasieu Lake
weather_observation.impacted_coast: upper Texas coast through south-central Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds possible (gusts 74–110 mph) Friday afternoon–night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground level possible in Calcasieu Lake and adjacent waterways
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches, isolated 15 inches, leading to significant flash and river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornado risk beginning late Thursday night and continuing through Friday; life-threatening surf and rip currents
